issue.title: Build a Counter CLI
issue.body:
## Build a Simple Counter CLI

A minimal command-line counter application in TypeScript.

### Commands
```bash
counter increment   # Increase by 1
counter decrement   # Decrease by 1
counter show        # Display current value
counter reset       # Reset to 0
```

### Files (each worker handles ONE file only)
- `src/types.ts` - Counter interface
- `src/counter.ts` - Counter logic
- `src/storage.ts` - File storage
- `src/index.ts` - CLI with commander

### Technical
- TypeScript
- Store counter in counter.json
- Keep it very simple

ems.task: Create project foundation: initialize .gitignore for Node.js, package.json with TypeScript dependencies and bin entry, tsconfig.json with commonjs module target
ems.error: No workers merged - all had conflicts

ems.task: Implement counter data model and file persistence layer - Counter interface in src/types.ts, JSON read/write logic in src/storage.ts, and counter state management in src/counter.ts

workers.task: Create TypeScript type definitions for the counter data model in src/types.ts - define Counter interface with value property and any related types
Implement JSON file persistence layer in src/storage.ts - create read/write functions to load and save counter data to counter.json, importing Counter type from src/types.ts

Implement counter state management and business logic in src/counter.ts - create Counter class with increment, decrement, reset, and show methods, importing types from src/types.ts and storage functions from src/storage.ts

ems.task: Build CLI interface using commander.js in src/index.ts with increment, decrement, show, and reset subcommands that invoke the counter logic

workers.task: Create TypeScript type definition for Counter interface in src/types.ts
Create Counter class with increment, decrement, show, and reset methods in src/counter.ts that uses the Counter type from src/types.ts
Create file storage module in src/storage.ts for persisting counter value to counter.json

analysisSummary: Implement a minimal TypeScript CLI counter application with increment, decrement, show, and reset commands, persisting state to counter.json
